snippet: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton pressed Russia and China to back decisive action against the Syrian president before the violence draws neighboring countries into the conflict.
abstract: Sec of State Hillary Rodham Clinton, in news conference in Copenhagen, says that Russia’s refusal to take decisive action against Syria's Pres Bashar al-Assad threatens to precipitate the civil war that Russian diplomats have said they want to avoid; she presses both Russia and China to back action before the violence draws neighboring countries into the conflict.

byline.original: By STEVEN LEE MYERS and J. DAVID GOODMAN
byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers reported from Washington, and J. David Goodman from New York. Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting from Istanbul, and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton pressed Russia and China to back decisive action against the Syrian president before the violence draws neighboring countries into the conflict.

headline.seo: Syrian War Likely if Russia Doesn’t Act, Clinton Says
headline.main: Clinton Says Russian Inaction May Lead to Syrian Civil War
headline.print_headline: Clinton Says Inaction by Russia May Lead to Syrian Civil War

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
